frameDefinitions: This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language.
This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
This frame characterizes the likelihood that a Hypothetical_event will happen as a position on a scale of impossible to inevitable.
This frame has to do with the repetition (and especially the frequency of repetition) of an event.
Some Content is part of the mental model of a Cognizer.
A Cognizer makes a Decision, which may be about an entity or a course of action.
frameExamples: I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.
It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
China will have to face a high <t>frequency</t> of sand storms in the years to come.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target	</t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.
The role specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place.
The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
A numerical representation of the probability that a Hypothetical_event will occur.
A metaphorical representation of the position on the scale of likelihood that the Hypothetical_event will occur.
The event that is expected to happen with a certain likelihood.
This role is used for any (bounded) <fen>Event</fen> whose frequency or iteration is described.
The extent to which the actually observed rate of occurrence of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> differs from the expected rate.
The <fen>Interval</fen> is a noun modified by the target word. The target word specifies the frequency of the <fen>Interval</fen> .
The <fen>Time_span</fen> is the length of time of the <fen>Interval</fen>. This role is incorporated by most of the lexical units in this frame.
The number of times per unit of real or scanning time that an <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is encountered.
An entity which the implicit cognizer encounters with the specified frequency.
The frequency feature of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is under discussion. All the lexical units in this frame incorporate this frame element.
The Time when the Event has a particular frequency.
The fact or idea which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is aware of.
The category whose applicability to the <fen>Content</fen> is known.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has awareness (or lack thereof) of the <fen>Content</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides on a course of action.
<fen>Decision</fen> identifies the entity or course of action upon which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides.
The time or time period over which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the decision.
The place where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the decision.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Evelyn</fex> spoke feelingly about what happened.
Evelyn said <fex>that she was not ready to leave</fex>.
Evelyn spoke candidly <fex>about her past</fex>.
Kim preached to me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
In some remarks <fex>at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.
<fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.
There's a <fex>95 %</fex> chance of rain today.
Chances are <fex>slim</fex> that he'll pull through.
He's got a small chance <fex>of making it out alive</fex>.
The country has been struck by frequent <fex>economic crises</fex>.
The Crested Lark (Galerida cristata) is  <fex>very</fex> frequent from the coastal plain to the mountains.
The meetings occurred at fortnightly <fex>intervals</fex>.
You have to renew the license every <fex>year</fex> .
The state government spends its fiscal year 2006 budget of $23.4 billion at a rate <fex>of $742 per second</fex>.
It costs about US$2.50 to travel 200km (124 mi), but <fex>buses</fex> are infrequent and only one or two buses a day service most routes.
These exposures were likely to be intermittent <fex>in frequency</fex> occurring only when workers were participating in activities at these specific areas.
<fex>That most of them are dangerous</fex> is not yet known.
The patient arrived with a suspected <fex>broken leg</fex>.
The <fex>long</fex> suspected killer has now released a statement outlining his thoughts on the criminal case.
<fex>Mo</fex> decided to quit the program.
Mo decided <fex>to quit the program</fex>.
The State Cabinet <fex>today</fex> decided to file an appeal in the Supreme Court seeking an extension of six months for implementation of its judgment
<fex>At the first</fex> crossroad we decided to wait.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Schedule 2 of the Chemical Weapons Convention
Holding Civil Society Workshops While Syria Burns
